Package me.zpath

Class ZPath

java.lang.Object
me.zpath.ZPath
public class ZPath extends Object

ZPath is a syntax for traversing a structure object, like a JSON object or XML, and retrieving matching nodes. It's similar in concept to XPath and JSONPath and JMESPath, but with an eye on legibility and consistency. The specification is at zpath.me. An example: 

 import me.zpath.ZPath;
 import java.util.List;
 Object context = ...;
 ZPath path = ZPath.compile("table/tr[td]");
 List<Object> match = path.eval(context).all();  // List of zero or more matches
 Object match = path.eval(context).first();      // The first match, or null if none

      Returns:
      the Result

    • eval

      public Result eval(Object node, EvalContext context)

      Evaluate this ZPath against the supplied object, using the specified EvalContext. If the context is null, Configuration.getFactories() will be scanned for one that can create an EvalContext for the supplied object. If none are found, throws IllegalArgumentException

      The return value is Result containing a list of objects that match the specified expression. They will be either reachable via the EvalContext from the supplied object, or String, Number, or Boolean constants if the ZPath evaluates to that type of object.

      Parameters:
      node - the object
      context - the context to evaluate that object in, or null to find one that matches
      Returns:
      the Result
